itemDescription: Member of the Queensland Legislative Assembly

wikipedia_page.main: William Thomas Lovejoy (1849 – 24 August 1913) was a Member of the Queensland Legislative Assembly.

link_mentions.page: Members of the Queensland Legislative Assembly, 1893–1896
response: :  On 17 July 1894, the seat of  Aubigny was declared vacant due to the insolvency of sitting Opposition member William Lovejoy. However, following an arrangement with his creditors, he was again eligible to be a member of parliament and stood for re-election at the resulting by-election on 4 August 1894. However, Opposition candidate William Thorn won the resulting by-election by a narrow margin of 8 votes.

link_mentions.page: Electoral results for the district of Aubigny
